meanings.definition: A measure of disorder or randomness in a system
meanings.sent1: The entropy of the room increased as the children played and scattered their toys everywhere.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use entropy to describe how chaotic a system is.
meanings.sent3: The entropy of my desk is so high that I can never find anything on it!
meanings.sent4: As the party went on, the entropy of the living room reached a peak with streamers and confetti everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The entropy of the forest after the storm was a sight to behold, with fallen trees and branches scattered in every direction.

meanings.definition: Lack of order or predictability; gradual decline into disorder
meanings.sent1: The entropy in the classroom was evident as the students moved around chaotically.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the entropy of the old building led to its crumbling and decay.
meanings.sent3: Trying to organize my closet felt like battling against the entropy of my clothes.
meanings.sent4: The entropy of the city streets at night gave them a mysterious and unpredictable vibe.
meanings.sent5: The entropy of the abandoned house was so high that even the walls seemed to be crumbling into disorder.
